text: ECOND UNDAY OF ENT EBRUARY 28 2021 As we enter into the Second Sunday of Lent February 27th 28th we join our Blessed Lord as He ascends Mount Tabor with Peter James and John And upon this holy mountain these three Apostles witness the glory of God as Jesus is transfigured before them Mark 9210 In this moment Jesus briefly reveals His divine glory and confirms the confession made by Peter short moments before Mark 82730 This overwhelming experience of Gods manifest glory serves to encourage these Apostles for the difficult journey that lies ahead Immediately following Peters confession Jesus offers the first prediction of His coming Passion and states that His followers would also have to carry His cross Mark 83133 From hearing these challenging words to seeing Jesus transfigured the Apostles begin to understand that it is necessary for us to undergo many hardships to enter the kingdom of God Acts 1422 And just as quickly as they climbed Mount Tabor so they descended from the heights The next mountain that they shall approach is Mount Calvary upon which our Blessed Lord will once again ascend and be lifted up in glory This next time however His glory will not be shown in the transfiguration but will be revealed upon the Cross For it is on that very same Cross on which hung the salvation of the world LTAR ERVER RAINING AND PDATES Last weekend we offered a refresher session for 19 of our altar servers This weekend we are offering a training session for all those in 4th12th Grade who are interested in becoming altar servers Beginning this weekend we will see a few updates to our altar server practices Most notably we will once again begin our procession from the back of the Church two servers will be assisting throughout Mass and our servers will resume setting the altar at the Offertory special Thank You to Dan Geimer for leading our refresher and training sessions and for all of our altar servers for assisting us in praying the Mass ENERAL ARISH PDATES This week we celebrate the first Friday March 5th of the month As has become our parish custom we will offer Adoration of the Blessed Sacrament from 9:00am following the morning 8:30am Mass until 6:00pm with the Litany of the Eucharist and benediction beginning at 5:45pm At 6:00pm we will offer our monthly First Friday Mass according the Extraordinary Form followed by Stations of the Cross at 7:00pm Due to our additional First Friday Mass Confessions this Friday will be heard from 5:00pm to 5:45pm special Thank You to all those who are supporting the St Joseph Womens Group Raffle As a reminder the proceeds will be used to clean and refurbish our baptismal font Through baptism we are reborn into new life in Jesus Christ How fitting it is then that our St Joseph Womens Group under the protection of Our Lady of Good Counsel the Mother of God is leading the charge to ensure the upkeep of the baptismal font This coming week we will begin the first round of interviews for our Director of Sacred Music and Liturgy position Weve received various applicants both locally and nationally Please continue to keep our search process in your prayers this Lenten season Faithfully in
